column1: Which protein is involved in maintaining the stability of the erythrocyte membrane?
column8:
Correct: C. Spectrin
Spectrin forms a cytoskeletal network beneath the erythrocyte membrane, providing mechanical stability and flexibility.

column8:

column1: Which of the listed neurons typically have a pear-shaped (pyriform) body?
column8:
Correct: A. Purkinje cells
Purkinje neurons of the cerebellar cortex have a characteristic pyriform (pear-shaped) cell body.

column1: Which of the listed cells produces histamine?
column8:
Correct: C. Basophils and mast cells
Basophils and mast cells store and release histamine in inflammatory and allergic responses.

column1: Which is the neurotransmitter of the neuromuscular junction?
column8:
Correct: C. Acetylcholine
Neuromuscular transmission uses acetylcholine acting on nicotinic receptors.

column1: Which cellular compartment contains the Nissl granules?
column8:
Correct: C. Cytoplasm
Nissl granules (rough ER) are located in the cytoplasm of neurons.

column1: Which cells are involved in humoral immunity?
column8:
Correct: B. B cells
Humoral immunity is mediated by B lymphocytes and their antibodies.

column1: Which cells are involved in cell-mediated immunity?
column8:
Correct: C. Mature T-cells
Cell-mediated immunity is mediated by T lymphocytes.

column1: Which are the major types of cardiomyocytes?
column3: Myocardial contractile cells and myocardial conducting cells

column8:

Activated B lymphocytes differentiate into plasma cells.

Neutrophils have a characteristic multilobed nucleus (2–5 lobes).
